To obtain a position in my field of Electronics with a company that offers opportunities for advancement based on strong technical skills and work performance.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Technical Infrastructure Program Manager, CXBT

Location: Seattle, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Description

Are you inspired by owning multiple tech infrastructures worldwide to measure customer experience? Is problem solving through hardware and software in your DNA? Would you enjoy working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, start-up like environment? If you answered yes to any of these, you've got to check out the CXBT Automation team.

Our vision is to build the automated services to measure customers’ experience on any devices at any location, produce scalable and affordable data to drive continuous improvement on Amazon products. We own the end to end hardware and software solutions, and operate multiple labs in Seattle and other international regions.

The Lab Innovation & Ops team within CXBT is responsible for designing the lab layouts, choosing the right hardware, and ensuring overall availability and reliability for all automation setups and devices. You will be part of a team of Technical Program Managers (TPMs), Technical Product Managers (PMTs) and engineers who committed to innovate and ensure a world class digital experience for all users. You will have an enormous opportunity to make a large impact on the lab strategy, vendor selection, building tools and approaches those will enable us to dramatically scale up our automation setups. You and your team will use scripting, analysis and root cause deep dives to gain insight into our lab’s operational issues and proactively solve them at scale.

Key job responsibilities

The right candidate will be inspired and motivated to do the following on a daily basis:

 Lead infrastructure and network design to build new facilities and labs. Plan, organize, schedule, and supervise the day-to-day device support activities, including troubleshooting, configuration, installation and sanity checks. Establish metrics that measure, monitor, and maintain alignment to Service Level Agreements (SLA) while fostering continuous improvement. Coordinate with stakeholders to improve processes through inventory management, vendor selection, software integration and hardware implementation. Ensure we adhere to and exceed local Health & Safety standards in all our labs. Create and maintain metrics on all aspects of our lab operations and utilize those metrics to drive positive changes. Create and maintain strategic roadmaps aligned to lab, product and device expansion. Oversee our hardware technical stack, innovate and determine what should be outsourced versus designed in-house.

About The Team

Customer Experience and Business Trends (CXBT) is an organization made up of a diverse suite of functions dedicated to deeply understand and improve customer experience, globally. We are a team of builders that develop products, services, ideas, and various ways of leveraging data to influence product and service offerings - for almost every business at Amazon - for every customer (e.g., consumers, developers, sellers/brands, employees, investors, streamers, gamers). Our approach is based on determining the customer need, along with problem solving, and we work backwards from there. We use technical and non-technical approaches and stay aware of industry and business trends. We are a global team made up of diverse set of profiles, skills, and backgrounds - including: Product Managers, Software Developers, Computer Vision experts, Solutions Architects, Data Scientists, Business Intelligence Engineers, Business Analysts, Risk Managers, and more.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Seattle, WA, USA

Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Mechanical/Electrical Engineering or similar field. 5+ years of relevant experience working in labs/data centers or critical infrastructure with an emphasis on hardware and equipment operation. Experience in capacity planning, incident and problem management, root cause analysis and correction. Excellent verbal and written communication skills to include Technical Writing.

Preferred Qualifications

 Project management experience leveraging AGILE, SCRUM, KANBAN, or KAIZEN. Experience in designing and running R&D/lab environment. Experience of standard manufacturing process from prototyping to assembly. Experience leading support engineering for complex electronics in consumer electronics (or a similar field). CCNA/CCNP/JNCIA/JNCIS certifications a plus. Keen knowledge of IT hardware and testing (e.g. Power Supplies, Network Switches, Cameras, Microphones and Speakers).

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $118,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $231,300/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2617046

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
